title: PACE: Proposal media content
description: Proposers lack a way to add media (interviews, demos, article) after the finalizing proposal stage and after funding to help auditing

f6_assessments.q0: It is important to have a way for proposers to keep in touch with the community on the progress of their proposals. A single secure for media to be uploaded could be useful here. I do worry however how much this would be used. Individual proposals that are creating things for a given audience should be reaching out to their audiences anyway. As we grow to hundreds of funded proposals, can this scale in terms of the community actually looking at the all? Audits are generally done by independent parties, whilst this could help proposers communicate, there would be no vetting on what is supplied here thus I am not sure it counts towards auditability, though may help in terms of accountability.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan seems relatively simple to get current data into a database and add the ability to continue to add media files. As such the proposer seems to have the experience to be able to deliver this.
f6_assessments.q2: Delivery of the technical side of this proposal should be relatively simple to audit the progress on. What needs to be added is how do we measure the success of this project in terms of growing auditability in an efficient way. Its not clear that even measuring the number of uploaded media files in total or per proposal would really address the core of this challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal will help to enable the addition of media content for the review of proposals.  This will help out with the increased visibility for the review of proposals.  This proposal although not directly answers the assessment part of the fund category it does help with building and growing Catalyst's presence and to demonstrate past proposals capabilities.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has had previous experience as winners of previous funds, strong relationships within the community.  They also have the necessary qualifications to run the project as proposed.  A more robust roadmap with deliverables would be helpful to completely quell any fears about the technical and time constraints that the project may have.  Overall though for the designed features of enabling media content this project seems to be sound and feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: This plan has a basic outline of what it is trying to accomplish and a more detailed roadmap to which to measure success and deliverables would answer all the questions or doubts that there may be to measure the progress of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: The ability for not only the original proposers, but also implementers, and the overall community to attach an audit trail through multimedia content such as interviews improves the ability to keep track of a proposal's progress. This is especially important for funded proposals as this challenge aims to ensure transparency in the use of Cardano's treasury resources. The proposal, if implemented, will have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are well-known in the Catalyst community and have been contributing to the Cardano ecosystem regularly. The requirements for fulfilling this proposal are met by the proposer and co-proposer.
f6_assessments.q2: References to Fund5 proposals are helpful in understanding the overall implementation plan. The budget is detailed enough with reasonable labor rates and other costs listed. The KPIs listed make sense given the challenge setting. The main selling point is that the implementation of the proposal itself in its final form would make the audit of the proposal very easy.

f6_assessments.q0:
-The language used in the proposal is difficult to understand and to interpret. My suggestion is to work through the proposal with a native English speaking person, to clear out the inconsistencies in the writing.
-"The enriched proposal data from these fund 5 proposals.." It is not clearly defined how this data processing will commence. It is difficult to understand the workflow of the project and it's development steps. 
-"..can fork and consume" (data) this expression, following out of the same sentence as example above, I suggest to use a common verbal expression for the meaning of 'fork' and 'consume', in order to make this proposal acceptable by the general public.
-It is difficult to understand this proposal by posting links of the proposals from previous fund with Ideascale presentation. All documentation should be created explicitly for this proposal and edited in a coherent format. 

I strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge as  it needs more work on the wording and clarification.
f6_assessments.q1:
-References to the mentioned proposals from previous fund are emitting confidence to the feasibility of the project, if my understanding is correct, it tries to build on these previous funds. And the team referrs to 15+ years of experience.
-Under budget breakdown, everything sounds orderly and simplified, except the time allocation for collaboration and maintenance, in amount of 5 % each, of the proposed required time of 240 hours. That's 10%, or 24 hours spent on collaboration and maintenance. The collaboration and maintenance lack  description, this makes the budget declared difficult to evaluate. That is why my final conclusion on budget described is that it lacks more clarification.
I neither agree nor disagree that it is likely that this proposal will be successfuly implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
-"Both proposers themselves or the community should be able to suggest content that should be added to the proposal data so it is easy for the community to understand everything going on for a given proposal - especially those that have been funded!"
In the quoted sentence above, it is not clearly stated why both, the proposers and the community, should suggest the content that should improve the auditability of the proposal. Particularly, it is not stated why the community should provide any media on a specific project, run by a proposer or a Group of people (team). The people or the community, interacting with a project from the outside, can't have the necessary knowledge to decide or suggest what content should be added to the data. If the opposite is expected, this would imply the community has the know-how and capacity, to support the transparency of the proposals auditability. On this note, the clarification is missing.
-Under success metrics, the proposer sees success in tracking the (user?) traffic to the proposal pages, I guess here, the proposer, is referring to the 'pages'(?) on proposers 'PACE' audit platform. Furthermore, as success metric, the proposer suggests that increased amount of proposal information will provide successful auditability of the proposals on this platform. 
And under 'what success looks like' it provides explanation how this increasing amount of media will have impact on communities engagement. All three mentioned statements do not provide metrics that could define the success of this proposal. These statements encompass the impact of the proposal. 
In summary, I disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
Very nice idea and impactful in the challenge of the campaign!
it would be much easier to audit funded projects and also for proposers to prove their work was done.
The problem statement is clear and solution addreesses it completely. proposal is well written, with a proper schedule.


As suggestion, I'd make the content as interactive as possible without the need to open the media in other tabs/pages or download them, being able to see and play them in the proposal page. As an extra step (maybe for a future fund), interaactive dashboards would also work great.
f6_assessments.q1:
PACE team already work with similar solution and have enough capability/experience to put this in place. they also partnered up with other team (Lidonation) which makes it even more feasible.

Budget breakdown and resource allocation are also well defined and fair.
Plan is sensible and is according to what is proposed here
f6_assessments.q2:
There are good deliverables and milestones in schedule.
Regarding the metrics they are also good but theres no target. For instance, it is proposd to  increasing the number of people viewing proposals but to how much?
I'd also include a comparison metric between views in proposals with and without media attachment

There could be also phase to collect feedback on the quality of the tool both by proposers and regular viewers.

One thing much apreciated here is a simple website to consolidate all their update on projects - it really helps!

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement and solution presented are reasonable and within the scope of the challenge. One of the essentials of auditability is to disseminate information about funded proposals to the community. 
The integration of media and the updating of these media would enable a catalog of information, updates, and a library of funded proposals information. This information, media and files would bring more transparency and could simplify the audit process.

The goals and metrics mentioned indicate a positive impact on the items established in the challenge brief.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team described relevant experiences(including sources) for the development of the proposal, such as aptitude in web development (front end/back end) and has been actively participating in Catalyst for several months, having contributed with several projects related to community integration (voters, proposers and CAs). such as Catalist Swarm and https://projectcatalyst.org/ 
There is description of a reasonable and well-structured plan, with a cohesive timeline; A budget breakdown was included according to the allocation of time in different activities and the hourly rate. The established values are reasonable and compatible with the values corresponding to web development rates and other activities. Considering the fact that the team split complementary proposals into 3 different proposals, it's not clear why the budget allocated for Hosting and Software is the same for all proposals ($500USD)

I understand that there will be a lot of manual work to move the content of the proposals funded in previous funds to the website, but it is not clear if there will be any way to automate the IdeaScale attachments for the website in the future. Doing this work manually from now on is not efficient.
f6_assessments.q2: There is clarity on the problem, solution and how they relate to the challenge. Relevant metrics were included. KPIs not included. I would recommend including KPIs for greater objectivity and to improve auditability. The roadmap has relevant goals, improving auditability.

solution: Tool for letting proposers or community members to attach media content to a given proposal both during and after the funding process
experience: 5 years of web/mobile development experience, 1 year of strategic consulting experience, funded for Catalyst focussed proposals in fund 5
